parts.data: The SAS Programmer/Predictive Modeler will be working in a team environment and will be responsible for developing analysis data sets for modeling work and performing statistical analysis. In addition, the SAS Programmer/Predictive Modeler will work with Subject Matter Experts to develop business requirements for model operation, test implementation of models to requirements, and work with Subject Matter Experts to research/evaluate model performance in investigations. Selected candidates may not need to travel for all projects outside of their metro area. However, all candidates must be able and willing to travel based on assigned project demand. Travel requirements may vary but could be up to 100%. Candidates are not able to refuse project based on travel Stay connected by subscribing to the IBMjobs blog for career insights, news and latest job opportunities. IBM Global Business Services: Join a Leader. Consult with us. (2252) Required High School Diploma/GED At least 2 years experience in analytical methods, statistics At least 2 years experience in SAS programming skills At least 2 years experience in SQL queries, and large scale data manipulation At least 2 years experience in designing/producing sound descriptive statistical analysis At least 2 years experience in analytical report writing and client presentation Readiness to travel Up to 4 days a week (home on weekends-based on project requirements) English: Basic knowledge Preferred Bachelor's Degree English : Intermediate
parts.name: Job description
